descriptions: Student does not demonstrate understanding of coordinate system components (axes, origin, coordinates).
Student shows limited understanding of coordinate system, struggling with axes or origin identification.
Student identifies axes and origin but has difficulty relating coordinates to points on the plane.
Student can locate points using coordinates but struggles to explain the relationship between the numbers and axes.
Student correctly uses coordinates to locate points, demonstrating understanding of axes and origin. Can explain the relationship between points and coordinates.

Student demonstrates a complete understanding of the coordinate system and can accurately locate and explain the relationship between points and their coordinates. Can apply this understanding to complex problems.
Student is unable to plot points correctly on the coordinate plane.
Student struggles to plot points, with frequent errors in direction or distance from the origin.
Student plots some points correctly but makes several errors in either x or y coordinate placement.
Student generally plots points correctly but occasionally reverses coordinates or miscounts distance.
Student plots points accurately with only minor errors. Demonstrates a good understanding of how to translate coordinates to points.
Student consistently plots points accurately and efficiently. Demonstrates a strong command of coordinate placement and can quickly adjust to different scales.
Student cannot apply coordinate plane concepts to solve real-world problems.
Student struggles to connect real-world situations to the coordinate plane, unable to formulate a solution.
Student attempts to apply coordinate plane but struggles to accurately represent the problem or interpret the results.
Student can set up the problem on the coordinate plane but may have difficulty interpreting the results in the context of the real-world situation.
Student successfully uses the coordinate plane to solve real-world problems, demonstrating a good understanding of how the coordinate system can model situations.

Student expertly applies coordinate plane skills to solve complex, real-world problems, demonstrating an exceptional ability to model situations and interpret results with clear and insightful explanations.
